file_content.text: [This datapad seems to be a personal journal. The last few entries might explain how all of the residents of this village were killed.]
Entry 27: We're loading up the dewbacks to take our first supply contribution to Sobrik. I think Colonel Adun is going to be very pleased.
If the trade today goes well, I think we'll have an agreement. The Imperials definitely need these supplies, and we could use their protection.
I'm just glad I haven't run into Captain Varmett. With our history together... he could ruin everything. He always said he'd kill me if I left him.
Entry 28: They're all dead. Everyone. Our whole group. We were supposed to meet Colonel Adun with the supplies. Captain Varmett was there instead.
He saw me, and he shouted something to his soldiers, and they just started shooting. I saw Jev go down. Saw my mother burn.
I ran. I ran all the way home. But they followed me. I blocked the door. I don't know how long I have.
Entry 29: He's coming. I hear him outside, shouting to his men. They're going door-to-door. They're killing everyone in the village.
We just wanted to help. We had extra supplies. We knew the Empire needed them. Colonel Adun promised we'd be safe.
I wonder what Captain Varmett will tell him. How he'll excuse murdering his new allies, all because of me.
I just hope someone finds the truth. I hope someone makes Varmett pay.
